Virus Diseases/Eye Infections, Viral/Herpes Zoster Ophthalmicus
Record.Description: Virus infection of the Gasserian ganglion and its nerve branches characterized by pain and vesicular eruptions with much swelling. Ocular involvement is usually heralded by a vesicle on the tip of the nose. This area is innervated by the nasociliary nerve.
